title: Hongke (Amy) Wu
text:
I am a Data Scientist Assistant at UAB Medicine with a background in clinical medicine, epidemiology, and biostatistics. Before joining UAB Medicine, I earned my MS in Biostatistics from Case Western Reserve University, where I trained under the mentorship of Dr.Ming Wang. My research focuses on pharmacoepidemiology, immunology and rheumatology, using real-world data sources like Medicare claims, Komodo Health, and EHRs to study treatment outcomes and healthcare utilization. I work with Dr.Jeffrey Curtis and Dr.Ye Liu, contributing to ongoing projects that integrate advanced statistical modeling with clinical insight. With proficiency in SAS, R, and SQL, I aim to generate evidence that informs patient care and policy decisions.


M.S. in Biostatistics | Case Western Reserve University | Cleveland, OH | Aug 2023 - Aug 2024
M.P.H in Epidemiology | Tulane University | New Orleans, LA | Aug 2016 - May 2018
M.D. in Clinical Medicine | Hubei University for Nationalities | Enshi, China | Sep 2011 - Jun 2016

title: Publications

Hongke Wu, Ye Liu, Jingyi Zhang, Bisakha Sen, Jeffrey R. Curtis. Individual and Community-level Determinants of Osteoporosis Treatment Following Fracture Among Medicare Beneficiaries. (Under Review)

\[\text{2025 Accepted Conference Abstracts}\]
